subject: From junk food to the latest gadgets...the hard sell to your kids is on.  That story only on the CBS Evening News with Katie Couric

QUOTE OF THE DAY"All paid jobs absorb and 
      degrade the mind." - Aristotle 



DID YOU KNOW?Basketball was invented 
      in 1891 by James Naismith. He set out to invent a game to occupy students 
      between the football and baseball seasons. 



TONIGHT ON THE CBS EVENING NEWSHere's an early 
      look at what we are working on for tonight's broadcast of the CBS Evening 
      News from Anchor and Managing Editor, Katie Couric... Hi 
      everyone, The merger of Daimler and Chrysler was one of the most 
      expensive – and least fruitful – in American automaking history. Now 
      DaimlerChrysler is dropping its struggling Chrysler Group, which is 
      getting picked up for $7.4 billion by a private equity firm. Anthony 
      Mason will have the story of Chrysler’s sale and Nancy Cordes 
      will look at what’s pinching American automakers, from union costs to 
      pensions and sales numbers. Turning to Iraq, we’ll have two 
      stories. First: the anatomy of an ambush. Mark Strassmann will 
      report on the abduction of three American soldiers in Saturday’s early 
      morning hours south of Baghdad. He’ll break down what happened and the 
      effort to get the missing soldiers back. And it has been reported 
      that between 100,000 and 300,000 barrels of Iraq’s oil has been 
      unaccounted for – that’s every day for the past four years. Our Sharyl 
      Attkisson asks why – was it corruption, smuggling or simply poor 
      accounting? Cycling great Floyd Landis opened his doping hearing 
      denying the charge. He also criticized the testing procedure used by the 
      Tour de France, Bill Whitaker will report. As for health 
      news, I’ll talk with our Dr. Jon LaPook about the surprising study 
      that shows the number of women older than 40 getting mammograms is on the 
      decline. It is the first time the rate has fallen, according to the 
      National Cancer Institute. And I’ll wrap-up our broadcast with the 
      first piece in a series we’ve been working on called “Gotta Have It: 
      The Hard Sell To Kids.” I’ll take a look at the multitude of ways 
      cartoon characters and other faces our kids and grandkids love are used to 
      market everything from junk food to exercise. Experts say there’s more at 
      stake here than just money. I hope you’ll join us. Katie

TONIGHT ON DAVID 
      LETTERMANDave sits down with actor 
      Mike Myers AND actress America Ferrara! 



 
TUESDAY MORNING 
      ON THE EARLY SHOW
Harry Smith, Julie Chen, and 
      Russ Mitchell anchor THE EARLY SHOW from New York. Hannah Storm anchors from Las Vegas, NV. 
      Dave Price will bring us the weather. Along with the top 
      news of the day, we will also have the following stories:
EATING DISORDERS AND MODELS: Ever since eating disorders 
      contributed to the deaths of two super skinny South American models last 
      year, the fashion industry has examined standards that force models to fit 
      into clothes most women can't wear. For now, thin is still in but 
      EARLY SHOW National Correspondent 
      Tracy Smith has the story of a designer who's out to change that. 
      BEST YOU CAN BE: BAGS OF SUMMER: With the rise of spring, 
      summer cannot be far and fashion’s hottest accessory very well may be the 
      handbag. But what are the best picks for every occasion? Whether you are 
      looking for a carry-all to tote all of your belongings, or a slim clutch 
      for a night out on the town, choosing a bag that suits you does not have 
      to be a difficult affair. Kim France, Editor of Lucky magazine, 
      will join us Tuesday morning with her top picks for summer. 
      HIGH SOCIETY: SUBSTANCE ABUSE: Joseph A. Califano, Jr. 
      served as Lyndon B. Johnson's domestic affairs chief and Jimmy Carter's 
      secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare, where he started the nation's 
      first national anti-smoking campaign. In 1992, Califano founded The 
      National Center on Addiction and Substance Abuse. Now, he has written, 
      High Society, a detailed look at how substance abuse ravages 
      America and what we can do about it. Substance abuse has touched every 
      family in some way and Tuesday morning Califano will join us with more. 
      VINCE GILL: Country star Vince Gill’s latest album, 
      These Days, is a four-CD set of 43 new and original songs, blending 
      traditional country and bluegrass, jazz and rock 'n roll. Vince recently 
      turned fifty, and is showing no signs of slowing down. Tuesday night he 
      will be performing at the Academy of Country Music Awards where he is 
      nominated for three awards including Album of the Year. Tuesday morning, 
      Vince will join our own Hannah Storm live from Las Vegas. 
      HOME THEATER: CAGNEY AND LACEY: 25TH ANNIVERSARY: It has 
      been twenty-five years since Cagney and Lacey first captured our 
      attention solving crime. Now, a special DVD has been released showcasing 
      Season One of stars Sharon Gless and Tyne Daly’s adventures. Tuesday 
      morning, we’ll take a look at the special features the DVD offers and 
      Sharon Gless and Tyne Daly will stop by our plaza for a trip down memory 
      lane. TONY NOMINATIONS: The nominations for the 61st Annual 
      Tony Awards will be announced live from the New York Public Library for 
      the Performing Arts. Actors Jane Krakowski and Taye Diggs will announce 
      this year’s nominations. The 61st Annual Tony Awards will take place at 
      Radio City Music Hall on June 10th. JOSH TURNER PERFORMS: 
      Josh Turner has become one of country music's brightest young stars since 
      Long Black Train, his critically acclaimed, platinum-selling debut 
      album hit shelves in 2003. For his sophomore effort entitled Your 
      Man, which debuted at number one on the country music charts, Josh dug 
      deeper into his South Carolina roots to display a more mature side. He's 
      also nominated for three Academy of Country Music Awards Tuesday night, 
      including a nod for Song of the Year for Would You Go With Me. He 
      will join us Tuesday morning to perform his hit song Me and God.
